alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Grimes; Montgomery; Walker; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 2:13PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN AUSTIN...GRIMES... SOUTHEASTERN BRAZOS...EASTERN WASHINGTON...WESTERN MONTGOMERY... NORTHERN WALLER...SOUTHWESTERN WALKER AND NORTHWESTERN HARRIS COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM CDT... At 212 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Anderson to 6 miles northwest of Todd Mission to near Prairie View. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... College Station, northwestern Conroe, Tomball, Navasota, Hempstead, Willis, Prairie View, Pinehurst, The Woodlands, Washington, Waller, Panorama Village, Magnolia, Pine Island, Montgomery, Stagecoach, Millican, Anderson, Todd Mission, and Lake Conroe Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
